title: Add NAIST-jdic support to Kuromoji
description: We should look into adding NAIST-jdic support to Kuromoji as this dictionary is better than the current IPADIC.  The NAIST-jdic license seems fine, but needs a formal check-off before any inclusion in Lucene.

comments.content:
this is already supported: you can enable this by changing 2 lines of build.xml 
and rebuilding the dictionary,

but then some tests will fail: because I think this one handles punctuation etc
significantly differently. Are we sure its truly better? Or does it just have more words?
comments.author: Robert Muir
